{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the information provided in the documents, the most probable causative organism for encephalitis without any skin lesions in a neonate is HSV II. Document [2] mentions that eight infants with HSV encephalitis had no skin, eye, or mucous membrane lesions. Document [5] also describes a case of an infant with herpetic papulovesicular skin lesions followed by acute encephalitis. Both of these documents suggest that HSV can cause encephalitis without skin lesions. Therefore, the answer choice is B. HSV II.", "answer_choice": "B"}
